brief_summary.textblock:
Surgery to correct scoliosis (spinal fusion)generates a severe pain intensity  rending pain
      management a complex task. Several studies have found out that pharmacological interventions
      alone were not enough to provide optimal pain management for these patients. The
      investigators developed a DVD on guided imagery, customized for teenagers, to help them cope
      better with their pain. The investigators believe that this type of intervention combined
      with their usual analgesic medication will help them to control their pain and foster
      rehabilitation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Management Using Guided Imagery for Adolescents Post-spinal Fusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Aged between 11 and 20 years old

          -  Have undergone a posterior/anterior arthrodesis surgery for idiopathic scoliosis

          -  Able to write and understand French

          -  Requires a computer or DVD player at home.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosed with a moderate cognitive deficit or severe mental retardation

intervention.description: A 30-min DVD was developed which included general information on pain management as well as a section on guided imagery using sounds and images.

clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of Guided Imagery on Pain, Anxiety, and Coping for Adolescents Post-spinal Fusion

primary_outcome.description: Pain was measured before the patients left the hospital on their 7th postoperative day (T-1, time of discharge from hospital). It was measured again at two week post-discharge (T-2) and also at one month post-discharge (T-3) on their visit to the orthopedic clinic. Our primary outcome was at T-2.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Level of pain intensity at two weeks after the surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety was measured as baseline data on the pre-operative visit (24 hrs before surgery). It was also measured at two weeks post-discharge and at one month on the day of the visit to the orthopedic clinic.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Level of anxiety from 24-hrs before the surgery, to two weeks and to one month after the surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Coping strategies of adolescents regarding their pain management were also measured pre-operatively (24 hrs before surgery), at two weeks and one month post-surgery.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Level of coping from Baseline (pre-operative), to two weeks and to one month after the surgery
